title: A mathematician of my acquaintance describes her process for solving problems in just this way. She reports that she knows the solution to the problem (which usually comes to her in the shower) well before she can formulate a proof, and often before she has any story at all to tell about why the solution is right. This is by no means atypical. See Henri Poincaré, “Mathematical Creation
